summary: This bill, the "Revitalizing and Empowering Freedom Settlements Through Opportunity, Resilience, and Education Act" (RESTORE Act), proposes establishing the National Freedom Settlements Preservation Program within the National Park Service. It aims to recognize, research, document, preserve, and commemorate Freedom Settlements (also known as Freedmen's Settlements, Freedom Colonies, or Black Towns) established by formerly enslaved African Americans after the Civil War. The program will provide grants for preservation, research, and educational programming, and establish a registry of settlements. The bill also establishes a Freedom Settlements Advisory Committee and emphasizes private property owner consent.
